H0.text: Tetrahedral is the electron domain geometry of ammonia.

H1.text: Membranes is the electron domain geometry of ammonia.

H2.text: Atoms are the electron domain geometry of ammonia.

H3.text: Neurons is the electron domain geometry of ammonia.

A4.text: The central nitrogen atom has five outer electrons with an additional electron from each hydrogen atom. This gives a total of eight electrons, or four electron pairs that are arranged tetrahedrally.

A5.text: The ammonia molecule has a trigonal pyramidal shape, as predicted by the valence shell electron pair repulsion theory (VSEPR theory) with an experimentally determined bond angle of 106.7Â°.
